intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium kalsoeense subsp. leucograptum, commonly known as the white-stemmed hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to specific regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and leaf structures. The plant typically features upright stems that are densely hairy, especially along the nodes, and leaves that are lanceolate to ovate in shape. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a single head, with ray florets that are often shorter than the central disk florets. This subspecies is distinguished by its pale green to white stems and is often found in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and meadows.
